title: IRTRANS_SND_8
description:
IRTRANS_SND_8 allows users to send remote control commands to the IR￾Trans. If IN_x is TRUE the specifed device and key code in setup is sent to

the IRTrans which outputs in turn as a real remote control commands. With

T_REPEAT the repeat time for sending can be specifed . If IN_0 remains

constant to TRUE so always this key code sent repeated after the time

T_REPEAT. If a change to a diferent IN_x occures this code will send imme￾diately and then again delayed with T_REPEAT, if it remains a long period

of time. At output KEY the currently controlled KEY will be displayed. KEY

= 0 means that no IN_x is active. The values 1-3 are the IN_0 - IN_7.

45 Version 1.21

Chapter 7. Data Logger

 7. Data Logger
name: IRTRANS_SND_8

input.name: IN_0
input.description: Input flag to send keycode x (TRUE = send keycode). This applies to IN_0 through IN_7.

input.name: T_REPEAT
input.description: Time interval for re-sending the key code when the respective input remains TRUE.

input.name: S_BUF
input.description: Data structure for transmitting the key code.

input.name: DEV_CODE
input.description: String representing the remote control name to be decoded.

input.name: KEY_CODE_0
input.description: Key code to be sent (for IN_0). This applies to KEY_CODE_0 through KEY_CODE_7.

output.name: KEY
output.description: Output representing the currently active key codes. KEY = 0 means no inputs are active.
